author: alx9r
body:
I'm not sure if this is something that should be fixed or not.  I'm opening this issue for two main reasons:

* to hopefully save others the effort I went through to find the cause of this contention
* in case a shared AuthorizationManager is a cause of the contention in #7035's repro

Steps to reproduce
------------------

Invoke [authorizationManagerContention.ps1](https://gist.github.com/alx9r/3be86f9913d1198a5d8d534ecde318d4).

Expected behavior
-----------------

I expected the amount of time it takes to open runspaces in parallel to be similar whether `AuthorizationManager` is shared or not.

Actual behavior
---------------

Sharing `AuthorizationManager` causes an approximately 0.5x slow down on my 16-core test system.

```none
ProcessorCount: 16

Name    Elapsed(ms)
----    -----------
One Per        3764
Shared         6974
```

Environment data
----------------


title: Sharing AuthorizationManager causes contention when opening Runspaces in parallel
